meanings.definition: A person who exceeds or goes beyond in achievement or excellence.
meanings.sent1: The young artist was a surpasser in her class, always creating beautiful paintings.
meanings.sent2: The surpassers in the competition received gold medals for their outstanding performances.
meanings.sent3: The surpassers in the baking contest made cakes so delicious, they disappeared in minutes!
meanings.sent4: In the world of music, she was a surpasser, her voice reaching heights others could only dream of.
meanings.sent5: The surpassers in the science fair amazed everyone with their innovative projects.

meanings.definition: Those who outdo or outstrip others in a particular activity or quality.
meanings.sent1: The team of surpassers won the championship with their exceptional teamwork.
meanings.sent2: The surpassers in the race finished first, leaving their competitors far behind.
meanings.sent3: The surpassers in the dance-off moved so gracefully, they seemed to float on air!
meanings.sent4: Her skills as a surpasser in mathematics were unmatched, solving complex problems effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The surpassers in the art show displayed masterpieces that left the audience in awe.
